page.title: 06ECCLESFIELD CHURCH
page.content: Ecclesfield Church is about 1500 years old.It is situated on a hill and can be seen from a great distance in some directions .It was built of stone by the monks of St.Wandrille's Abbey in Normandy.The massive tower was erected in the 15th century.Dodsworth wrote in 1620"the church is called(andthat deservedly)by the village,the 'Mynster of the Moors'beign the fairesr church for stone wood and glass that ever I came in of a country church."Unfortunatley,the stained glass windows were smashed by the puritans in the time of Oliver Cromwell .The few remaining fragments of mediaeval glass are now in a window in the north transept.The oldest thing in the church is an anglo saxon cross,it stands near to the door in the south transept.
